APISettings.description: Settings for interacting with the Prefect API

url.description: The URL of the Prefect API. If not set, the client will attempt to infer it.
url.title: Url

auth_string.description: The auth string used for basic authentication with a self-hosted Prefect API. Should be kept secret.
auth_string.title: Auth String

key.description: The API key used for authentication with the Prefect API. Should be kept secret.
key.title: Key

tls_insecure_skip_verify.description: If `True`, disables SSL checking to allow insecure requests. Setting to False is recommended only during development. For example, when using self-signed certificates.
tls_insecure_skip_verify.title: Tls Insecure Skip Verify

ssl_cert_file.description: This configuration settings option specifies the path to an SSL certificate file.
ssl_cert_file.title: Ssl Cert File

enable_http2.description: If true, enable support for HTTP/2 for communicating with an API. If the API does not support HTTP/2, this will have no effect and connections will be made via HTTP/1.1.
enable_http2.title: Enable Http2

request_timeout.description: The default timeout for requests to the API
request_timeout.title: Request Timeout

APISettings.title: APISettings

colors.description: If True, use colors in CLI output. If `False`, output will not include colors codes.
colors.title: Colors

prompt.description: If `True`, use interactive prompts in CLI commands. If `False`, no interactive prompts will be used. If `None`, the value will be dynamically determined based on the presence of an interactive-enabled terminal.
prompt.title: Prompt

wrap_lines.description: If `True`, wrap text by inserting new lines in long lines in CLI output. If `False`, output will not be wrapped.
wrap_lines.title: Wrap Lines

ClientMetricsSettings.description: Settings for controlling metrics reporting from the client

enabled.description: Whether or not to enable Prometheus metrics in the client.
enabled.title: Enabled

port.description: The port to expose the client Prometheus metrics on.
port.title: Port

ClientMetricsSettings.title: ClientMetricsSettings

ClientSettings.description: Settings for controlling API client behavior

max_retries.description:
The maximum number of retries to perform on failed HTTP requests.
        Defaults to 5. Set to 0 to disable retries.
        See `PREFECT_CLIENT_RETRY_EXTRA_CODES` for details on which HTTP status codes are
        retried.
max_retries.title: Max Retries

retry_jitter_factor.description:
A value greater than or equal to zero to control the amount of jitter added to retried
        client requests. Higher values introduce larger amounts of jitter.
        Set to 0 to disable jitter. See `clamped_poisson_interval` for details on the how jitter
        can affect retry lengths.
retry_jitter_factor.title: Retry Jitter Factor

retry_extra_codes.description:
A list of extra HTTP status codes to retry on. Defaults to an empty list.
        429, 502 and 503 are always retried. Please note that not all routes are idempotent and retrying
        may result in unexpected behavior.
retry_extra_codes.title: Retry Extra Codes

csrf_support_enabled.description:
Determines if CSRF token handling is active in the Prefect client for API
        requests.

        When enabled (`True`), the client automatically manages CSRF tokens by
        retrieving, storing, and including them in applicable state-changing requests
csrf_support_enabled.title: Csrf Support Enabled

custom_headers.description:
Custom HTTP headers to include with every API request to the Prefect server.
        Headers are specified as key-value pairs. Note that headers like 'User-Agent'
        and CSRF-related headers are managed by Prefect and cannot be overridden.
custom_headers.title: Custom Headers

ClientSettings.title: ClientSettings

CloudSettings.description: Settings for interacting with Prefect Cloud

api_url.description: API URL for Prefect Cloud. Used for authentication with Prefect Cloud.
api_url.title: Api Url

enable_orchestration_telemetry.description: Whether or not to enable orchestration telemetry.
enable_orchestration_telemetry.title: Enable Orchestration Telemetry

max_log_size.description: Maximum size in characters for a single log when sending logs to Prefect Cloud.
max_log_size.title: Max Log Size

ui_url.description: The URL of the Prefect Cloud UI. If not set, the client will attempt to infer it.
ui_url.title: Ui Url

CloudSettings.title: CloudSettings

default_work_pool_name.description: The default work pool to use when creating deployments.
default_work_pool_name.title: Default Work Pool Name

default_docker_build_namespace.description: The default Docker namespace to use when building images.
default_docker_build_namespace.title: Default Docker Build Namespace

warn.description: If `True`, warn on usage of experimental features.
warn.title: Warn

plugins.description: Settings for the experimental plugin system

default_retries.description: This value sets the default number of retries for all flows.
default_retries.title: Default Retries

default_retry_delay_seconds.description: This value sets the default retry delay seconds for all flows.
default_retry_delay_seconds.title: Default Retry Delay Seconds

logging_level.description: The default logging level for Prefect's internal machinery loggers.
logging_level.title: Logging Level

level.description: The default logging level for Prefect loggers.
level.title: Level

config_path.description: A path to a logging configuration file. Defaults to $PREFECT_HOME/logging.yml
config_path.title: Config Path

extra_loggers.description: Additional loggers to attach to Prefect logging at runtime.
extra_loggers.title: Extra Loggers

log_prints.description: If `True`, `print` statements in flows and tasks will be redirected to the Prefect logger for the given run.
log_prints.title: Log Prints

colors.description: If `True`, use colors in CLI output. If `False`, output will not include colors codes.
colors.title: Colors

markup.description:
Whether to interpret strings wrapped in square brackets as a style.
        This allows styles to be conveniently added to log messages, e.g.
        `[red]This is a red message.[/red]`. However, the downside is, if enabled,
        strings that contain square brackets may be inaccurately interpreted and
        lead to incomplete output, e.g.
        `[red]This is a red message.[/red]` may be interpreted as
        `[red]This is a red message.[/red]`.
markup.title: Markup

LoggingToAPISettings.description: Settings for controlling logging to the API

enabled.description: If `True`, logs will be sent to the API.
enabled.title: Enabled

batch_interval.description: The number of seconds between batched writes of logs to the API.
batch_interval.title: Batch Interval

batch_size.description: The number of logs to batch before sending to the API.
batch_size.title: Batch Size

max_log_size.description: The maximum size in characters for a single log. When connected to Prefect Cloud, this value is capped at `PREFECT_CLOUD_MAX_LOG_SIZE` (default 25,000).
max_log_size.title: Max Log Size

when_missing_flow.description:
Controls the behavior when loggers attempt to send logs to the API handler from outside of a flow.
        
        All logs sent to the API must be associated with a flow run. The API log handler can
        only be used outside of a flow by manually providing a flow run identifier. Logs
        that are not associated with a flow run will not be sent to the API. This setting can
        be used to determine if a warning or error is displayed when the identifier is missing.

        The following options are available:

        - "warn": Log a warning message.
        - "error": Raise an error.
        - "ignore": Do not log a warning message or raise an error.
when_missing_flow.title: When Missing Flow

LoggingToAPISettings.title: LoggingToAPISettings

PluginsSettings.description: Settings for configuring the experimental plugin system

allow.description: Comma-separated list of plugin names to allow. If set, only these plugins will be loaded.
allow.title: Allow

deny.description: Comma-separated list of plugin names to deny. These plugins will not be loaded.
deny.title: Deny

setup_timeout_seconds.description: Maximum time in seconds for all plugins to complete their setup hooks.
setup_timeout_seconds.title: Setup Timeout Seconds

strict.description: If True, exit if a required plugin fails during setup.
strict.title: Strict

safe_mode.description: If True, load plugins but do not execute their hooks. Useful for testing.
safe_mode.title: Safe Mode

PluginsSettings.title: PluginsSettings

ResultsSettings.description: Settings for controlling result storage behavior

default_serializer.description: The default serializer to use when not otherwise specified.
default_serializer.title: Default Serializer

persist_by_default.description: The default setting for persisting results when not otherwise specified.
persist_by_default.title: Persist By Default

default_storage_block.description: The `block-type/block-document` slug of a block to use as the default result storage.
default_storage_block.title: Default Storage Block

local_storage_path.description: The default location for locally persisted results. Defaults to $PREFECT_HOME/storage.
local_storage_path.title: Local Storage Path

ResultsSettings.title: ResultsSettings

RunnerServerSettings.description: Settings for controlling runner server behavior

enable.description: Whether or not to enable the runner's webserver.
enable.title: Enable

host.description: The host address the runner's webserver should bind to.
host.title: Host

port.description: The port the runner's webserver should bind to.
port.title: Port

log_level.description: The log level of the runner's webserver.
log_level.title: Log Level

missed_polls_tolerance.description: Number of missed polls before a runner is considered unhealthy by its webserver.
missed_polls_tolerance.title: Missed Polls Tolerance

RunnerServerSettings.title: RunnerServerSettings

process_limit.description: Maximum number of processes a runner will execute in parallel.
process_limit.title: Process Limit

poll_frequency.description: Number of seconds a runner should wait between queries for scheduled work.
poll_frequency.title: Poll Frequency

heartbeat_frequency.description: Number of seconds a runner should wait between heartbeats for flow runs.
heartbeat_frequency.title: Heartbeat Frequency

SQLAlchemyConnectArgsSettings.description:
Settings for controlling SQLAlchemy connection behavior; note that these settings only take effect when
using a PostgreSQL database.

application_name.description: Controls the application_name field for connections opened from the connection pool when using a PostgreSQL database with the Prefect backend.
application_name.title: Application Name

statement_cache_size.description: Controls statement cache size for PostgreSQL connections. Setting this to 0 is required when using PgBouncer in transaction mode. Defaults to None.
statement_cache_size.title: Statement Cache Size

prepared_statement_cache_size.description: Controls the size of the statement cache for PostgreSQL connections. When set to 0, statement caching is disabled. Defaults to None to use SQLAlchemy's default behavior.
prepared_statement_cache_size.title: Prepared Statement Cache Size

tls.description: Settings for controlling SQLAlchemy mTLS behavior

SQLAlchemyConnectArgsSettings.title: SQLAlchemyConnectArgsSettings

SQLAlchemySettings.description:
Settings for controlling SQLAlchemy behavior; note that these settings only take effect when
using a PostgreSQL database.

connect_args.description: Settings for controlling SQLAlchemy connection behavior

pool_size.description: Controls connection pool size of database connection pools from the Prefect backend.
pool_size.title: Pool Size

pool_recycle.description: This setting causes the pool to recycle connections after the given number of seconds has passed; set it to -1 to avoid recycling entirely.
pool_recycle.title: Pool Recycle

pool_timeout.description: Number of seconds to wait before giving up on getting a connection from the pool. Defaults to 30 seconds.
pool_timeout.title: Pool Timeout

max_overflow.description: Controls maximum overflow of the connection pool. To prevent overflow, set to -1.
max_overflow.title: Max Overflow

SQLAlchemySettings.title: SQLAlchemySettings

SQLAlchemyTLSSettings.description:
Settings for controlling SQLAlchemy mTLS context when
using a PostgreSQL database.

enabled.description: Controls whether connected to mTLS enabled PostgreSQL when using a PostgreSQL database with the Prefect backend.
enabled.title: Enabled

ca_file.description: This configuration settings option specifies the path to PostgreSQL client certificate authority file.
ca_file.title: Ca File

cert_file.description: This configuration settings option specifies the path to PostgreSQL client certificate file.
cert_file.title: Cert File

key_file.description: This configuration settings option specifies the path to PostgreSQL client key file.
key_file.title: Key File

check_hostname.description: This configuration settings option specifies whether to verify PostgreSQL server hostname.
check_hostname.title: Check Hostname

SQLAlchemyTLSSettings.title: SQLAlchemyTLSSettings

ServerAPISettings.description: Settings for controlling API server behavior

auth_string.description: A string to use for basic authentication with the API in the form 'user:password'.
auth_string.title: Auth String

base_path.description: The base URL path to serve the API under.
base_path.title: Base Path

default_limit.description: The default limit applied to queries that can return multiple objects, such as `POST /flow_runs/filter`.
default_limit.title: Default Limit

keepalive_timeout.description:
The API's keep alive timeout (defaults to `5`).
        Refer to https://www.uvicorn.org/settings/#timeouts for details.

        When the API is hosted behind a load balancer, you may want to set this to a value
        greater than the load balancer's idle timeout.

        Note this setting only applies when calling `prefect server start`; if hosting the
        API with another tool you will need to configure this there instead.
keepalive_timeout.title: Keepalive Timeout

csrf_protection_enabled.description:
Controls the activation of CSRF protection for the Prefect server API.

        When enabled (`True`), the server enforces CSRF validation checks on incoming
        state-changing requests (POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE), requiring a valid CSRF
        token to be included in the request headers or body. This adds a layer of
        security by preventing unauthorized or malicious sites from making requests on
        behalf of authenticated users.

        It is recommended to enable this setting in production environments where the
        API is exposed to web clients to safeguard against CSRF attacks.

        Note: Enabling this setting requires corresponding support in the client for
        CSRF token management. See PREFECT_CLIENT_CSRF_SUPPORT_ENABLED for more.
csrf_protection_enabled.title: Csrf Protection Enabled

csrf_token_expiration.description:
Specifies the duration for which a CSRF token remains valid after being issued
        by the server.

        The default expiration time is set to 1 hour, which offers a reasonable
        compromise. Adjust this setting based on your specific security requirements
        and usage patterns.
csrf_token_expiration.title: Csrf Token Expiration

cors_allowed_origins.description:
A comma-separated list of origins that are authorized to make cross-origin requests to the API.

        By default, this is set to `*`, which allows requests from all origins.
cors_allowed_origins.title: Cors Allowed Origins

cors_allowed_methods.description:
A comma-separated list of methods that are authorized to make cross-origin requests to the API.

        By default, this is set to `*`, which allows requests from all methods.
cors_allowed_methods.title: Cors Allowed Methods

cors_allowed_headers.description:
A comma-separated list of headers that are authorized to make cross-origin requests to the API.

        By default, this is set to `*`, which allows requests from all headers.
cors_allowed_headers.title: Cors Allowed Headers

ServerAPISettings.title: ServerAPISettings

lease_storage.description: The module to use for storing concurrency limit leases.
lease_storage.title: Lease Storage

initial_deployment_lease_duration.description: Initial duration for deployment concurrency lease in seconds.
initial_deployment_lease_duration.title: Initial Deployment Lease Duration

maximum_concurrency_slot_wait_seconds.description: The maximum number of seconds to wait before retrying when a concurrency slot cannot be acquired.
maximum_concurrency_slot_wait_seconds.title: Maximum Concurrency Slot Wait Seconds

ServerDatabaseSettings.description: Settings for controlling server database behavior

connection_url.description:
A database connection URL in a SQLAlchemy-compatible
        format. Prefect currently supports SQLite and Postgres. Note that all
        Prefect database engines must use an async driver - for SQLite, use
        `sqlite+aiosqlite` and for Postgres use `postgresql+asyncpg`.

        SQLite in-memory databases can be used by providing the url
        `sqlite+aiosqlite:///file::memory:?cache=shared&uri=true&check_same_thread=false`,
        which will allow the database to be accessed by multiple threads. Note
        that in-memory databases can not be accessed from multiple processes and
        should only be used for simple tests.
connection_url.title: Connection Url

driver.description: The database driver to use when connecting to the database. If not set, the driver will be inferred from the connection URL.
driver.title: Driver

user.description: The user to use when connecting to the database.
user.title: User

name.description: The name of the Prefect database on the remote server, or the path to the database file for SQLite.
name.title: Name

password.description: The password to use when connecting to the database. Should be kept secret.
password.title: Password

echo.description: If `True`, SQLAlchemy will log all SQL issued to the database. Defaults to `False`.
echo.title: Echo

migrate_on_start.description: If `True`, the database will be migrated on application startup.
migrate_on_start.title: Migrate On Start

timeout.description: A statement timeout, in seconds, applied to all database interactions made by the Prefect backend. Defaults to 10 seconds.
timeout.title: Timeout

connection_timeout.description: A connection timeout, in seconds, applied to database connections. Defaults to `5`.
connection_timeout.title: Connection Timeout

ServerDatabaseSettings.title: ServerDatabaseSettings

concurrency_slot_wait_seconds.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying when a deployment flow run cannot secure a concurrency slot from the server.
concurrency_slot_wait_seconds.title: Concurrency Slot Wait Seconds

name.description: The name of the Docket instance.
name.title: Name

url.description: The URL of the Redis server to use for Docket.
url.title: Url

ServerEphemeralSettings.description: Settings for controlling ephemeral server behavior

enabled.description: Controls whether or not a subprocess server can be started when no API URL is provided.
enabled.title: Enabled

startup_timeout_seconds.description:
The number of seconds to wait for the server to start when ephemeral mode is enabled.
        Defaults to `20`.
startup_timeout_seconds.title: Startup Timeout Seconds

ServerEphemeralSettings.title: ServerEphemeralSettings

ServerEventsSettings.description: Settings for controlling behavior of the events subsystem

stream_out_enabled.description: Whether or not to stream events out to the API via websockets.
stream_out_enabled.title: Stream Out Enabled

related_resource_cache_ttl.description: The number of seconds to cache related resources for in the API.
related_resource_cache_ttl.title: Related Resource Cache Ttl

maximum_labels_per_resource.description: The maximum number of labels a resource may have.
maximum_labels_per_resource.title: Maximum Labels Per Resource

maximum_related_resources.description: The maximum number of related resources an Event may have.
maximum_related_resources.title: Maximum Related Resources

maximum_size_bytes.description: The maximum size of an Event when serialized to JSON
maximum_size_bytes.title: Maximum Size Bytes

expired_bucket_buffer.description: The amount of time to retain expired automation buckets
expired_bucket_buffer.title: Expired Bucket Buffer

proactive_granularity.description: How frequently proactive automations are evaluated
proactive_granularity.title: Proactive Granularity

retention_period.description: The amount of time to retain events in the database.
retention_period.title: Retention Period

maximum_websocket_backfill.description: The maximum range to look back for backfilling events for a websocket subscriber.
maximum_websocket_backfill.title: Maximum Websocket Backfill

websocket_backfill_page_size.description: The page size for the queries to backfill events for websocket subscribers.
websocket_backfill_page_size.title: Websocket Backfill Page Size

messaging_broker.description: Which message broker implementation to use for the messaging system, should point to a module that exports a Publisher and Consumer class.
messaging_broker.title: Messaging Broker

messaging_cache.description: Which cache implementation to use for the events system. Should point to a module that exports a Cache class.
messaging_cache.title: Messaging Cache

causal_ordering.description: Which causal ordering implementation to use for the events system. Should point to a module that exports a CausalOrdering class.
causal_ordering.title: Causal Ordering

maximum_event_name_length.description: The maximum length of an event name.
maximum_event_name_length.title: Maximum Event Name Length

ServerEventsSettings.title: ServerEventsSettings

ServerFlowRunGraphSettings.description: Settings for controlling behavior of the flow run graph

max_nodes.description: The maximum size of a flow run graph on the v2 API
max_nodes.title: Max Nodes

max_artifacts.description: The maximum number of artifacts to show on a flow run graph on the v2 API
max_artifacts.title: Max Artifacts

ServerFlowRunGraphSettings.title: ServerFlowRunGraphSettings

ServerLogsSettings.description: Settings for controlling behavior of the logs subsystem

stream_out_enabled.description: Whether or not to stream logs out to the API via websockets.
stream_out_enabled.title: Stream Out Enabled

stream_publishing_enabled.description: Whether or not to publish logs to the streaming system.
stream_publishing_enabled.title: Stream Publishing Enabled

ServerLogsSettings.title: ServerLogsSettings

ServerServicesCancellationCleanupSetting.description: Settings for controlling the cancellation cleanup service

enabled.description: Whether or not to start the cancellation cleanup service in the server application.
enabled.title: Enabled

loop_seconds.description: The cancellation cleanup service will look for non-terminal tasks and subflows this often. Defaults to `20`.
loop_seconds.title: Loop Seconds

ServerServicesCancellationCleanupSetting.title: ServerServicesCancellationCleanupSettings

ServerServicesEventLoggerSettings.description: Settings for controlling the event logger service

enabled.description: Whether or not to start the event logger service in the server application.
enabled.title: Enabled

ServerServicesEventLoggerSettings.title: ServerServicesEventLoggerSettings

ServerServicesEventPersisterSettings.description: Settings for controlling the event persister service

enabled.description: Whether or not to start the event persister service in the server application.
enabled.title: Enabled

batch_size.description: The number of events the event persister will attempt to insert in one batch.
batch_size.title: Batch Size

flush_interval.description: The maximum number of seconds between flushes of the event persister.
flush_interval.title: Flush Interval

batch_size_delete.description: The number of expired events and event resources the event persister will attempt to delete in one batch.
batch_size_delete.title: Batch Size Delete

ServerServicesEventPersisterSettings.title: ServerServicesEventPersisterSettings

ServerServicesForemanSettings.description: Settings for controlling the foreman service

enabled.description: Whether or not to start the foreman service in the server application.
enabled.title: Enabled

loop_seconds.description: The foreman service will check for offline workers this often. Defaults to `15`.
loop_seconds.title: Loop Seconds

inactivity_heartbeat_multiple.description: The number of heartbeats that must be missed before a worker is marked as offline. Defaults to `3`.
inactivity_heartbeat_multiple.title: Inactivity Heartbeat Multiple

fallback_heartbeat_interval_seconds.description:
The number of seconds to use for online/offline evaluation if a worker's heartbeat
        interval is not set. Defaults to `30`.
fallback_heartbeat_interval_seconds.title: Fallback Heartbeat Interval Seconds

deployment_last_polled_timeout_seconds.description:
The number of seconds before a deployment is marked as not ready if it has not been
        polled. Defaults to `60`.
deployment_last_polled_timeout_seconds.title: Deployment Last Polled Timeout Seconds

work_queue_last_polled_timeout_seconds.description:
The number of seconds before a work queue is marked as not ready if it has not been
        polled. Defaults to `60`.
work_queue_last_polled_timeout_seconds.title: Work Queue Last Polled Timeout Seconds

ServerServicesForemanSettings.title: ServerServicesForemanSettings

ServerServicesLateRunsSettings.description: Settings for controlling the late runs service

enabled.description: Whether or not to start the late runs service in the server application.
enabled.title: Enabled

loop_seconds.description: The late runs service will look for runs to mark as late this often. Defaults to `5`.
loop_seconds.title: Loop Seconds

after_seconds.description: The late runs service will mark runs as late after they have exceeded their scheduled start time by this many seconds. Defaults to `5` seconds.
after_seconds.title: After Seconds

ServerServicesLateRunsSettings.title: ServerServicesLateRunsSettings

ServerServicesPauseExpirationsSettings.description: Settings for controlling the pause expiration service

enabled.description:
Whether or not to start the paused flow run expiration service in the server
        application. If disabled, paused flows that have timed out will remain in a Paused state
        until a resume attempt.
enabled.title: Enabled

loop_seconds.description: The pause expiration service will look for runs to mark as failed this often. Defaults to `5`.
loop_seconds.title: Loop Seconds

ServerServicesPauseExpirationsSettings.title: ServerServicesPauseExpirationsSettings

ServerServicesRepossessorSettings.description: Settings for controlling the repossessor service

enabled.description: Whether or not to start the repossessor service in the server application.
enabled.title: Enabled

loop_seconds.description: The repossessor service will look for expired leases this often. Defaults to `15`.
loop_seconds.title: Loop Seconds

ServerServicesRepossessorSettings.title: ServerServicesRepossessorSettings

ServerServicesSchedulerSettings.description: Settings for controlling the scheduler service

enabled.description: Whether or not to start the scheduler service in the server application.
enabled.title: Enabled

loop_seconds.description:
The scheduler loop interval, in seconds. This determines
        how often the scheduler will attempt to schedule new flow runs, but has no
        impact on how quickly either flow runs or task runs are actually executed.
        Defaults to `60`.
loop_seconds.title: Loop Seconds

deployment_batch_size.description:
The number of deployments the scheduler will attempt to
        schedule in a single batch. If there are more deployments than the batch
        size, the scheduler immediately attempts to schedule the next batch; it
        does not sleep for `scheduler_loop_seconds` until it has visited every
        deployment once. Defaults to `100`.
deployment_batch_size.title: Deployment Batch Size

max_runs.description:
The scheduler will attempt to schedule up to this many
        auto-scheduled runs in the future. Note that runs may have fewer than
        this many scheduled runs, depending on the value of
        `scheduler_max_scheduled_time`.  Defaults to `100`.
max_runs.title: Max Runs

min_runs.description:
The scheduler will attempt to schedule at least this many
        auto-scheduled runs in the future. Note that runs may have more than
        this many scheduled runs, depending on the value of
        `scheduler_min_scheduled_time`.  Defaults to `3`.
min_runs.title: Min Runs

max_scheduled_time.description:
The scheduler will create new runs up to this far in the
        future. Note that this setting will take precedence over
        `scheduler_max_runs`: if a flow runs once a month and
        `scheduler_max_scheduled_time` is three months, then only three runs will be
        scheduled. Defaults to 100 days (`8640000` seconds).
max_scheduled_time.title: Max Scheduled Time

min_scheduled_time.description:
The scheduler will create new runs at least this far in the
        future. Note that this setting will take precedence over `scheduler_min_runs`:
        if a flow runs every hour and `scheduler_min_scheduled_time` is three hours,
        then three runs will be scheduled even if `scheduler_min_runs` is 1. Defaults to
min_scheduled_time.title: Min Scheduled Time

insert_batch_size.description:
The number of runs the scheduler will attempt to insert in a single batch.
        Defaults to `500`.
insert_batch_size.title: Insert Batch Size

recent_deployments_loop_seconds.description: The number of seconds the recent deployments scheduler will wait between checking for recently updated deployments. Defaults to `5`.
recent_deployments_loop_seconds.title: Recent Deployments Loop Seconds

ServerServicesSchedulerSettings.title: ServerServicesSchedulerSettings

ServerServicesTaskRunRecorderSettings.description: Settings for controlling the task run recorder service

enabled.description: Whether or not to start the task run recorder service in the server application.
enabled.title: Enabled

ServerServicesTaskRunRecorderSettings.title: ServerServicesTaskRunRecorderSettings

ServerServicesTriggersSettings.description: Settings for controlling the triggers service

enabled.description: Whether or not to start the triggers service in the server application.
enabled.title: Enabled

pg_notify_reconnect_interval_seconds.description:
The number of seconds to wait before reconnecting to the PostgreSQL NOTIFY/LISTEN 
        connection after an error. Only used when using PostgreSQL as the database.
        Defaults to `10`.
pg_notify_reconnect_interval_seconds.title: Pg Notify Reconnect Interval Seconds

pg_notify_heartbeat_interval_seconds.description:
The number of seconds between heartbeat checks for the PostgreSQL NOTIFY/LISTEN 
        connection to ensure it's still alive. Only used when using PostgreSQL as the database.
        Defaults to `5`.
pg_notify_heartbeat_interval_seconds.title: Pg Notify Heartbeat Interval Seconds

ServerServicesTriggersSettings.title: ServerServicesTriggersSettings

logging_level.description: The default logging level for the Prefect API server.
logging_level.title: Logging Level

analytics_enabled.description:
When enabled, Prefect sends anonymous data (e.g. count of flow runs, package version)
        on server startup to help us improve our product.
analytics_enabled.title: Analytics Enabled

metrics_enabled.description: Whether or not to enable Prometheus metrics in the API.
metrics_enabled.title: Metrics Enabled

log_retryable_errors.description: If `True`, log retryable errors in the API and it's services.
log_retryable_errors.title: Log Retryable Errors

register_blocks_on_start.description: If set, any block types that have been imported will be registered with the backend on application startup. If not set, block types must be manually registered.
register_blocks_on_start.title: Register Blocks On Start

memoize_block_auto_registration.description: Controls whether or not block auto-registration on start
memoize_block_auto_registration.title: Memoize Block Auto Registration

memo_store_path.description: Path to the memo store file. Defaults to $PREFECT_HOME/memo_store.toml
memo_store_path.title: Memo Store Path

deployment_schedule_max_scheduled_runs.description: The maximum number of scheduled runs to create for a deployment.
deployment_schedule_max_scheduled_runs.title: Deployment Schedule Max Scheduled Runs

concurrency.description: Settings for controlling server-side concurrency limit handling

deployments.description: Settings for controlling server deployments behavior

docket.description: Settings for controlling server Docket behavior

events.description: Settings for controlling server events behavior

flow_run_graph.description: Settings for controlling flow run graph behavior

logs.description: Settings for controlling server logs behavior

services.description: Settings for controlling server services behavior

tasks.description: Settings for controlling server tasks behavior

ui.description: Settings for controlling server UI behavior

ServerTasksSchedulingSettings.description: Settings for controlling server-side behavior related to task scheduling

max_scheduled_queue_size.description: The maximum number of scheduled tasks to queue for submission.
max_scheduled_queue_size.title: Max Scheduled Queue Size

max_retry_queue_size.description: The maximum number of retries to queue for submission.
max_retry_queue_size.title: Max Retry Queue Size

pending_task_timeout.description: How long before a PENDING task are made available to another task worker.
pending_task_timeout.title: Pending Task Timeout

ServerTasksSchedulingSettings.title: ServerTasksSchedulingSettings

ServerTasksSettings.description: Settings for controlling server-side behavior related to tasks

tag_concurrency_slot_wait_seconds.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying when a task run cannot secure a concurrency slot from the server.
tag_concurrency_slot_wait_seconds.title: Tag Concurrency Slot Wait Seconds

max_cache_key_length.description: The maximum number of characters allowed for a task run cache key.
max_cache_key_length.title: Max Cache Key Length

ServerTasksSettings.title: ServerTasksSettings

enabled.description: Whether or not to serve the Prefect UI.
enabled.title: Enabled

api_url.description: The connection url for communication from the UI to the API. Defaults to `PREFECT_API_URL` if set. Otherwise, the default URL is generated from `PREFECT_SERVER_API_HOST` and `PREFECT_SERVER_API_PORT`.
api_url.title: Api Url

serve_base.description: The base URL path to serve the Prefect UI from.
serve_base.title: Serve Base

static_directory.description: The directory to serve static files from. This should be used when running into permissions issues when attempting to serve the UI from the default directory (for example when running in a Docker container).
static_directory.title: Static Directory

show_promotional_content.description: Whether or not to display promotional content in the UI, including upgrade prompts and marketing banners.
show_promotional_content.title: Show Promotional Content

thread_pool_max_workers.description: The maximum number of workers for ThreadPoolTaskRunner.
thread_pool_max_workers.title: Thread Pool Max Workers

process_pool_max_workers.description: The maximum number of workers for ProcessPoolTaskRunner.
process_pool_max_workers.title: Process Pool Max Workers

default_storage_block.description: The `block-type/block-document` slug of a block to use as the default storage for autonomous tasks.
default_storage_block.title: Default Storage Block

delete_failed_submissions.description: Whether or not to delete failed task submissions from the database.
delete_failed_submissions.title: Delete Failed Submissions

refresh_cache.description: If `True`, enables a refresh of cached results: re-executing the task will refresh the cached results.
refresh_cache.title: Refresh Cache

default_no_cache.description: If `True`, sets the default cache policy on all tasks to `NO_CACHE`.
default_no_cache.title: Default No Cache

disable_caching.description: If `True`, disables caching on all tasks regardless of cache policy.
disable_caching.title: Disable Caching

default_retries.description: This value sets the default number of retries for all tasks.
default_retries.title: Default Retries

default_retry_delay_seconds.description: This value sets the default retry delay seconds for all tasks.
default_retry_delay_seconds.title: Default Retry Delay Seconds

default_persist_result.description: If `True`, results will be persisted by default for all tasks. Set to `False` to disable persistence by default. Note that setting to `False` will override the behavior set by a parent flow or task.
default_persist_result.title: Default Persist Result

runner.description: Settings for controlling task runner behavior

scheduling.description: Settings for controlling client-side task scheduling behavior

test_mode.description: If `True`, places the API in test mode. This may modify behavior to facilitate testing.
test_mode.title: Test Mode

unit_test_mode.description: This setting only exists to facilitate unit testing. If `True`, code is executing in a unit test context. Defaults to `False`.
unit_test_mode.title: Unit Test Mode

unit_test_loop_debug.description: If `True` turns on debug mode for the unit testing event loop.
unit_test_loop_debug.title: Unit Test Loop Debug

test_setting.description: This setting only exists to facilitate unit testing. If in test mode, this setting will return its value. Otherwise, it returns `None`.
test_setting.title: Test Setting

heartbeat_seconds.description: Number of seconds a worker should wait between sending a heartbeat.
heartbeat_seconds.title: Heartbeat Seconds

query_seconds.description: Number of seconds a worker should wait between queries for scheduled work.
query_seconds.title: Query Seconds

prefetch_seconds.description: The number of seconds into the future a worker should query for scheduled work.
prefetch_seconds.title: Prefetch Seconds

host.description: The host address the worker's webserver should bind to.
host.title: Host

port.description: The port the worker's webserver should bind to.
port.title: Port

description:
Settings for Prefect using Pydantic settings.

See https://docs.pydantic.dev/latest/concepts/pydantic_settings

home.description: The path to the Prefect home directory. Defaults to ~/.prefect
home.title: Home

profiles_path.description: The path to a profiles configuration file. Supports \$PREFECT_HOME templating. Defaults to \$PREFECT_HOME/profiles.toml.
profiles_path.title: Profiles Path

debug_mode.description: If True, enables debug mode which may provide additional logging and debugging features.
debug_mode.title: Debug Mode

ui_url.description: The URL of the Prefect UI. If not set, the client will attempt to infer it.
ui_url.title: Ui Url

silence_api_url_misconfiguration.description:
If `True`, disable the warning when a user accidentally misconfigure its `PREFECT_API_URL`
        Sometimes when a user manually set `PREFECT_API_URL` to a custom url,reverse-proxy for example,
        we would like to silence this warning so we will set it to `FALSE`.
silence_api_url_misconfiguration.title: Silence Api Url Misconfiguration

title: Prefect Settings
